intro: Phreatia wariana var. montana, commonly known as the mountain phreatia, is a rare orchid species native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its erect, slender stems and large, showy flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary rainforests. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
